2565 
2566 PathState::PathState(int num_nodes, std::vector<int> path_start,
2567  std::vector<int> path_end)
2568  : num_nodes_(num_nodes),
2569  num_paths_(path_start.size()),
2570  num_nodes_threshold_(std::max(16, 4 * num_nodes_)) // Arbitrary value.
2571 {
2572  DCHECK_EQ(path_start.size(), num_paths_);
2573  DCHECK_EQ(path_end.size(), num_paths_);
2574  for (int p = 0; p < num_paths_; ++p) {
2575  path_start_end_.push_back({path_start[p], path_end[p]});
2576  }
2577  // Initial state is all unperformed: paths go from start to end directly.
2578  committed_index_.assign(num_nodes_, -1);
2579  committed_nodes_.assign(2 * num_paths_, {-1, -1});
2580  chains_.assign(num_paths_ + 1, {-1, -1}); // Reserve 1 more for sentinel.
2581  paths_.assign(num_paths_, {-1, -1});
2582  for (int path = 0; path < num_paths_; ++path) {
2583  const int index = 2 * path;
2584  const PathStartEnd start_end = path_start_end_[path];
2585  committed_index_[start_end.start] = index;
2586  committed_index_[start_end.end] = index + 1;
2587 
2588  committed_nodes_[index] = {start_end.start, path};
2589  committed_nodes_[index + 1] = {start_end.end, path};
2590 
2591  chains_[path] = {index, index + 2};
2592  paths_[path] = {path, path + 1};
2593  }
2594  chains_[num_paths_] = {0, 0}; // Sentinel.
2595  // Nodes that are not starts or ends are loops.
2596  for (int node = 0; node < num_nodes_; ++node) {
2597  if (committed_index_[node] != -1) continue; // node is start or end.
2598  committed_index_[node] = committed_nodes_.size();
2599  committed_nodes_.push_back({node, -1});
2600  }
2601  path_has_changed_.assign(num_paths_, false);
2602 }
2603 
2604 PathState::ChainRange PathState::Chains(int path) const {
2605  const PathBounds bounds = paths_[path];
2606  return PathState::ChainRange(chains_.data() + bounds.begin_index,
2607  chains_.data() + bounds.end_index,
2608  committed_nodes_.data());
2609 }
2610 
2611 PathState::NodeRange PathState::Nodes(int path) const {
2612  const PathBounds bounds = paths_[path];
2613  return PathState::NodeRange(chains_.data() + bounds.begin_index,
2614  chains_.data() + bounds.end_index,
2615  committed_nodes_.data());
2616 }
2617 
2618 void PathState::MakeChainsFromChangedPathsAndArcsWithSelectionAlgorithm() {
2619  int num_visited_changed_arcs = 0;
2620  const int num_changed_arcs = tail_head_indices_.size();
2621  const int num_committed_nodes = committed_nodes_.size();
2622  // For every path, find all its chains.
2623  for (const int path : changed_paths_) {
2624  const int old_chain_size = chains_.size();
2625  const ChainBounds bounds = chains_[paths_[path].begin_index];
2626  const int start_index = bounds.begin_index;
2627  const int end_index = bounds.end_index - 1;
2628  int current_index = start_index;
2629  while (true) {
2630  // Look for smallest non-visited tail_index that is no smaller than
2631  // current_index.
2632  int selected_arc = -1;
2633  int selected_tail_index = num_committed_nodes;
2634  for (int i = num_visited_changed_arcs; i < num_changed_arcs; ++i) {
2635  const int tail_index = tail_head_indices_[i].tail_index;
2636  if (current_index <= tail_index && tail_index < selected_tail_index) {
2637  selected_arc = i;
2638  selected_tail_index = tail_index;
2639  }
2640  }
2641  // If there is no such tail index, or more generally if the next chain
2642  // would be cut by end of path,
2643  // stack {current_index, end_index + 1} in chains_, and go to next path.
2644  // Otherwise, stack {current_index, tail_index+1} in chains_,
2645  // set current_index = head_index, set pair to visited.
2646  if (start_index <= current_index && current_index <= end_index &&
2647  end_index < selected_tail_index) {
2648  chains_.emplace_back(current_index, end_index + 1);
2649  break;
2650  } else {
2651  chains_.emplace_back(current_index, selected_tail_index + 1);
2652  current_index = tail_head_indices_[selected_arc].head_index;
2653  std::swap(tail_head_indices_[num_visited_changed_arcs],
2654  tail_head_indices_[selected_arc]);
2655  ++num_visited_changed_arcs;
2656  }
2657  }
2658  const int new_chain_size = chains_.size();
2659  paths_[path] = {old_chain_size, new_chain_size};
2660  }
2661  chains_.emplace_back(0, 0); // Sentinel.
2662 }
2663 
2664 void PathState::MakeChainsFromChangedPathsAndArcsWithGenericAlgorithm() {
2665  // TRICKY: For each changed path, we want to generate a sequence of chains
2666  // that represents the path in the changed state.
2667  // First, notice that if we add a fake end->start arc for each changed path,
2668  // then all chains will be from the head of an arc to the tail of an arc.
2669  // A way to generate the changed chains and paths would be, for each path,
2670  // to start from a fake arc's head (the path start), go down the path until
2671  // the tail of an arc, and go to the next arc until we return on the fake arc,
2672  // enqueuing the [head, tail] chains as we go.
2673  // In turn, to do that, we need to know which arc to go to.
2674  // If we sort all heads and tails by index in two separate arrays,
2675  // the head_index and tail_index at the same rank are such that
2676  // [head_index, tail_index] is a chain. Moreover, the arc that must be visited
2677  // after head_index's arc is tail_index's arc.
2678 
2679  // Add a fake end->start arc for each path.
2680  for (const int path : changed_paths_) {
2681  const PathStartEnd start_end = path_start_end_[path];
2682  tail_head_indices_.push_back(
2683  {committed_index_[start_end.end], committed_index_[start_end.start]});
2684  }
2685 
2686  // Generate pairs (tail_index, arc) and (head_index, arc) for all arcs,
2687  // sort those pairs by index.
2688  const int num_arc_indices = tail_head_indices_.size();
2689  arcs_by_tail_index_.resize(num_arc_indices);
2690  arcs_by_head_index_.resize(num_arc_indices);
2691  for (int i = 0; i < num_arc_indices; ++i) {
2692  arcs_by_tail_index_[i] = {tail_head_indices_[i].tail_index, i};
2693  arcs_by_head_index_[i] = {tail_head_indices_[i].head_index, i};
2694  }
2695  std::sort(arcs_by_tail_index_.begin(), arcs_by_tail_index_.end());
2696  std::sort(arcs_by_head_index_.begin(), arcs_by_head_index_.end());
2697  // Generate the map from arc to next arc in path.
2698  next_arc_.resize(num_arc_indices);
2699  for (int i = 0; i < num_arc_indices; ++i) {
2700  next_arc_[arcs_by_head_index_[i].arc] = arcs_by_tail_index_[i].arc;
2701  }
2702 
2703  // Generate chains: for every changed path, start from its fake arc,
2704  // jump to next_arc_ until going back to fake arc,
2705  // enqueuing chains as we go.
2706  const int first_fake_arc = num_arc_indices - changed_paths_.size();
2707  for (int fake_arc = first_fake_arc; fake_arc < num_arc_indices; ++fake_arc) {
2708  const int new_path_begin = chains_.size();
2709  int32_t arc = fake_arc;
2710  do {
2711  const int chain_begin = tail_head_indices_[arc].head_index;
2712  arc = next_arc_[arc];
2713  const int chain_end = tail_head_indices_[arc].tail_index + 1;
2714  chains_.emplace_back(chain_begin, chain_end);
2715  } while (arc != fake_arc);
2716  const int path = changed_paths_[fake_arc - first_fake_arc];
2717  const int new_path_end = chains_.size();
2718  paths_[path] = {new_path_begin, new_path_end};
2719  }
2720  chains_.emplace_back(0, 0); // Sentinel.
2721 }
2722 
2723 void PathState::CutChains() {
2724  if (is_invalid_) return;
2725  // Filter out unchanged arcs from changed_arcs_,
2726  // translate changed arcs to changed arc indices.
2727  // Fill changed_paths_ while we hold node_path.
2728  DCHECK_EQ(chains_.size(), num_paths_ + 1); // One per path + sentinel.
2729  DCHECK(changed_paths_.empty());
2730  tail_head_indices_.clear();
2731  int num_changed_arcs = 0;
2732  for (const auto& arc : changed_arcs_) {
2733  int node, next;
2734  std::tie(node, next) = arc;
2735  const int node_index = committed_index_[node];
2736  const int next_index = committed_index_[next];
2737  const int node_path = committed_nodes_[node_index].path;
2738  if (next != node &&
2739  (next_index != node_index + 1 || node_path == -1)) { // New arc.
2740  tail_head_indices_.push_back({node_index, next_index});
2741  changed_arcs_[num_changed_arcs++] = {node, next};
2742  if (node_path != -1 && !path_has_changed_[node_path]) {
2743  path_has_changed_[node_path] = true;
2744  changed_paths_.push_back(node_path);
2745  }
2746  } else if (node == next && node_path != -1) { // New loop.
2747  changed_arcs_[num_changed_arcs++] = {node, node};
2748  }
2749  }
2750  changed_arcs_.resize(num_changed_arcs);
2751 
2752  if (tail_head_indices_.size() + changed_paths_.size() <= 8) {
2753  MakeChainsFromChangedPathsAndArcsWithSelectionAlgorithm();
2754  } else {
2755  MakeChainsFromChangedPathsAndArcsWithGenericAlgorithm();
2756  }
2757 }
2758 
2759 void PathState::Commit() {
2760  DCHECK(!IsInvalid());
2761  if (committed_nodes_.size() < num_nodes_threshold_) {
2762  IncrementalCommit();
2763  } else {
2764  FullCommit();
2765  }
2766 }
2767 
2768 void PathState::Revert() {
2769  is_invalid_ = false;
2770  chains_.resize(num_paths_ + 1); // One per path + sentinel.
2771  for (const int path : changed_paths_) {
2772  paths_[path] = {path, path + 1};
2773  path_has_changed_[path] = false;
2774  }
2775  changed_paths_.clear();
2776  changed_arcs_.clear();
2777 }
2778 
2779 void PathState::CopyNewPathAtEndOfNodes(int path) {
2780  // Copy path's nodes, chain by chain.
2781  const int new_path_begin_index = committed_nodes_.size();
2782  const PathBounds path_bounds = paths_[path];
2783  for (int i = path_bounds.begin_index; i < path_bounds.end_index; ++i) {
2784  const ChainBounds chain_bounds = chains_[i];
2785  committed_nodes_.insert(committed_nodes_.end(),
2786  committed_nodes_.data() + chain_bounds.begin_index,
2787  committed_nodes_.data() + chain_bounds.end_index);
2788  }
2789  const int new_path_end_index = committed_nodes_.size();
2790  // Set new nodes' path member to path.
2791  for (int i = new_path_begin_index; i < new_path_end_index; ++i) {
2792  committed_nodes_[i].path = path;
2793  }
2794 }
2795 
2796 // TODO(user): Instead of copying paths at the end systematically,
2797 // reuse some of the memory when possible.
2798 void PathState::IncrementalCommit() {
2799  const int new_nodes_begin = committed_nodes_.size();
2800  for (const int path : ChangedPaths()) {
2801  const int chain_begin = committed_nodes_.size();
2802  CopyNewPathAtEndOfNodes(path);
2803  const int chain_end = committed_nodes_.size();
2804  chains_[path] = {chain_begin, chain_end};
2805  }
2806  // Re-index all copied nodes.
2807  const int new_nodes_end = committed_nodes_.size();
2808  for (int i = new_nodes_begin; i < new_nodes_end; ++i) {
2809  committed_index_[committed_nodes_[i].node] = i;
2810  }
2811  // New loops stay in place: only change their path to -1,
2812  // committed_index_ does not change.
2813  for (const auto& arc : ChangedArcs()) {
2814  int node, next;
2815  std::tie(node, next) = arc;
2816  if (node != next) continue;
2817  const int index = committed_index_[node];
2818  committed_nodes_[index].path = -1;
2819  }
2820  // Committed part of the state is set up, erase incremental changes.
2821  Revert();
2822 }
2823 
2824 void PathState::FullCommit() {
2825  // Copy all paths at the end of committed_nodes_,
2826  // then remove all old committed_nodes_.
2827  const int old_num_nodes = committed_nodes_.size();
2828  for (int path = 0; path < num_paths_; ++path) {
2829  const int new_path_begin = committed_nodes_.size() - old_num_nodes;
2830  CopyNewPathAtEndOfNodes(path);
2831  const int new_path_end = committed_nodes_.size() - old_num_nodes;
2832  chains_[path] = {new_path_begin, new_path_end};
2833  }
2834  committed_nodes_.erase(committed_nodes_.begin(),
2835  committed_nodes_.begin() + old_num_nodes);
2836 
2837  // Reindex path nodes, then loop nodes.
2838  constexpr int kUnindexed = -1;
2839  committed_index_.assign(num_nodes_, kUnindexed);
2840  int index = 0;
2841  for (const CommittedNode committed_node : committed_nodes_) {
2842  committed_index_[committed_node.node] = index++;
2843  }
2844  for (int node = 0; node < num_nodes_; ++node) {
2845  if (committed_index_[node] != kUnindexed) continue;
2846  committed_index_[node] = index++;
2847  committed_nodes_.push_back({node, -1});
2848  }
2849  // Committed part of the state is set up, erase incremental changes.
2850  Revert();
2851 }
2852 
2853 namespace {
2854 
2855 class PathStateFilter : public LocalSearchFilter {
2856  public:
2857  std::string DebugString() const override { return "PathStateFilter"; }
2858  PathStateFilter(std::unique_ptr<PathState> path_state,
2859  const std::vector<IntVar*>& nexts);
2860  void Relax(const Assignment* delta, const Assignment* deltadelta) override;
2861  bool Accept(const Assignment* delta, const Assignment* deltadelta,
2862  int64_t objective_min, int64_t objective_max) override {
2863  return true;
2864  }
2865  void Synchronize(const Assignment* delta,
2866  const Assignment* deltadelta) override{};
2867  void Commit(const Assignment* assignment, const Assignment* delta) override;
2868  void Revert() override;
2869  void Reset() override;
2870 
2871  private:
2872  const std::unique_ptr<PathState> path_state_;
2873  // Map IntVar* index to node, offset by the min index in nexts.
2874  std::vector<int> variable_index_to_node_;
2875  int index_offset_;
2876  // Used only in Reset(), this is a member variable to avoid reallocation.
2877  std::vector<bool> node_is_assigned_;
2878 };
2879 
2880 PathStateFilter::PathStateFilter(std::unique_ptr<PathState> path_state,
2881  const std::vector<IntVar*>& nexts)
2882  : path_state_(std::move(path_state)) {
2883  {
2884  int min_index = std::numeric_limits<int>::max();
2885  int max_index = std::numeric_limits<int>::min();
2886  for (const IntVar* next : nexts) {
2887  const int index = next->index();
2888  min_index = std::min<int>(min_index, index);
2889  max_index = std::max<int>(max_index, index);
2890  }
2891  variable_index_to_node_.resize(max_index - min_index + 1, -1);
2892  index_offset_ = min_index;
2893  }
2894 
2895  for (int node = 0; node < nexts.size(); ++node) {
2896  const int index = nexts[node]->index() - index_offset_;
2897  variable_index_to_node_[index] = node;
2898  }
2899 }
2900 
2901 void PathStateFilter::Relax(const Assignment* delta,
2902  const Assignment* deltadelta) {
2903  path_state_->Revert();
2904  for (const IntVarElement& var_value : delta->IntVarContainer().elements()) {
2905  if (var_value.Var() == nullptr) continue;
2906  const int index = var_value.Var()->index() - index_offset_;
2907  if (index < 0 || variable_index_to_node_.size() <= index) continue;
2908  const int node = variable_index_to_node_[index];
2909  if (node == -1) continue;
2910  if (var_value.Bound()) {
2911  path_state_->ChangeNext(node, var_value.Value());
2912  } else {
2913  path_state_->Revert();
2914  path_state_->SetInvalid();
2915  break;
2916  }
2917  }
2918  path_state_->CutChains();
2919 }
2920 
2921 void PathStateFilter::Reset() {
2922  path_state_->Revert();
2923  // Set all paths of path state to empty start -> end paths,
2924  // and all nonstart/nonend nodes to node -> node loops.
2925  const int num_nodes = path_state_->NumNodes();
2926  node_is_assigned_.assign(num_nodes, false);
2927  const int num_paths = path_state_->NumPaths();
2928  for (int path = 0; path < num_paths; ++path) {
2929  const int start = path_state_->Start(path);
2930  const int end = path_state_->End(path);
2931  path_state_->ChangeNext(start, end);
2932  node_is_assigned_[start] = true;
2933  node_is_assigned_[end] = true;
2934  }
2935  for (int node = 0; node < num_nodes; ++node) {
2936  if (!node_is_assigned_[node]) path_state_->ChangeNext(node, node);
2937  }
2938  path_state_->CutChains();
2939  path_state_->Commit();
2940 }
2941 
2942 // The solver does not guarantee that a given Commit() corresponds to
2943 // the previous Relax() (or that there has been a call to Relax()),
2944 // so we replay the full change call sequence.
2945 void PathStateFilter::Commit(const Assignment* assignment,
2946  const Assignment* delta) {
2947  path_state_->Revert();
2948  if (delta == nullptr || delta->Empty()) {
2949  Relax(assignment, nullptr);
2950  } else {
2951  Relax(delta, nullptr);
2952  }
2953  path_state_->Commit();
2954 }
2955 
2956 void PathStateFilter::Revert() { path_state_->Revert(); }
2957 
2958 } // namespace
2959 
2960 LocalSearchFilter* MakePathStateFilter(Solver* solver,
2961  std::unique_ptr<PathState> path_state,
2962  const std::vector<IntVar*>& nexts) {
2963  PathStateFilter* filter = new PathStateFilter(std::move(path_state), nexts);
2964  return solver->RevAlloc(filter);
2965 }
2966 
2967 UnaryDimensionChecker::UnaryDimensionChecker(
2968  const PathState* path_state, std::vector<Interval> path_capacity,
2969  std::vector<int> path_class, std::vector<std::vector<Interval>> demand,
2970  std::vector<Interval> node_capacity)
2971  : path_state_(path_state),
2972  path_capacity_(std::move(path_capacity)),
2973  path_class_(std::move(path_class)),
2974  demand_(std::move(demand)),
2975  node_capacity_(std::move(node_capacity)),
2976  index_(path_state_->NumNodes(), 0),
2977  maximum_partial_demand_layer_size_(
2978  std::max(16, 4 * path_state_->NumNodes())) // 16 and 4 are arbitrary.
2979 {
2980  const int num_nodes = path_state_->NumNodes();
2981  const int num_paths = path_state_->NumPaths();
2982  DCHECK_EQ(num_paths, path_capacity_.size());
2983  DCHECK_EQ(num_paths, path_class_.size());
2984  const int maximum_rmq_exponent = MostSignificantBitPosition32(num_nodes);
2985  partial_demand_sums_rmq_.resize(maximum_rmq_exponent + 1);
2986  previous_nontrivial_index_.reserve(maximum_partial_demand_layer_size_);
2987  FullCommit();
2988 }
2989 
2990 bool UnaryDimensionChecker::Check() const {
2991  if (path_state_->IsInvalid()) return true;
2992  for (const int path : path_state_->ChangedPaths()) {
2993  const Interval path_capacity = path_capacity_[path];
2994  if (path_capacity.min == std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min() &&
2995  path_capacity.max == std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max()) {
2996  continue;
2997  }
2998  const int path_class = path_class_[path];
2999  // Loop invariant: capacity_used is nonempty and within path_capacity.
3000  Interval capacity_used = node_capacity_[path_state_->Start(path)];
3001  capacity_used = {std::max(capacity_used.min, path_capacity.min),
3002  std::min(capacity_used.max, path_capacity.max)};
3003  if (capacity_used.min > capacity_used.max) return false;
3004 
3005  for (const auto chain : path_state_->Chains(path)) {
3006  const int first_node = chain.First();
3007  const int last_node = chain.Last();
3008 
3009  const int first_index = index_[first_node];
3010  const int last_index = index_[last_node];
3011 
3012  const int chain_path = path_state_->Path(first_node);
3013  const int chain_path_class =
3014  chain_path == -1 ? -1 : path_class_[chain_path];
3015  // Call the RMQ if the chain size is large enough;
3016  // the optimal value was found with the associated benchmark in tests,
3017  // in particular BM_UnaryDimensionChecker<ChangeSparsity::kSparse, *>.
3018  constexpr int kMinRangeSizeForRMQ = 4;
3019  if (last_index - first_index > kMinRangeSizeForRMQ &&
3020  path_class == chain_path_class &&
3021  SubpathOnlyHasTrivialNodes(first_index, last_index)) {
3022  // Compute feasible values of capacity_used that will not violate
3023  // path_capacity. This is done by considering the worst cases
3024  // using a range min/max query.
3025  const Interval min_max =
3026  GetMinMaxPartialDemandSum(first_index, last_index);
3027  const Interval prev_sum = partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0][first_index - 1];
3028  const Interval min_max_delta = {CapSub(min_max.min, prev_sum.min),
3029  CapSub(min_max.max, prev_sum.max)};
3030  capacity_used = {
3031  std::max(capacity_used.min,
3032  CapSub(path_capacity.min, min_max_delta.min)),
3033  std::min(capacity_used.max,
3034  CapSub(path_capacity.max, min_max_delta.max))};
3035  if (capacity_used.min > capacity_used.max) return false;
3036  // Move to last node's state, which is valid since we did not return.
3037  const Interval last_sum = partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0][last_index];
3038  capacity_used = {
3039  CapSub(CapAdd(capacity_used.min, last_sum.min), prev_sum.min),
3040  CapSub(CapAdd(capacity_used.max, last_sum.max), prev_sum.max)};
3041  } else {
3042  for (const int node : chain) {
3043  const Interval node_capacity = node_capacity_[node];
3044  capacity_used = {std::max(capacity_used.min, node_capacity.min),
3045  std::min(capacity_used.max, node_capacity.max)};
3046  if (capacity_used.min > capacity_used.max) return false;
3047  const Interval demand = demand_[path_class][node];
3048  capacity_used = {CapAdd(capacity_used.min, demand.min),
3049  CapAdd(capacity_used.max, demand.max)};
3050  capacity_used = {std::max(capacity_used.min, path_capacity.min),
3051  std::min(capacity_used.max, path_capacity.max)};
3052  }
3053  }
3054  }
3055  if (std::max(capacity_used.min, path_capacity.min) >
3056  std::min(capacity_used.max, path_capacity.max)) {
3057  return false;
3058  }
3059  }
3060  return true;
3061 }
3062 
3063 void UnaryDimensionChecker::Commit() {
3064  const int current_layer_size = partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0].size();
3065  int change_size = path_state_->ChangedPaths().size();
3066  for (const int path : path_state_->ChangedPaths()) {
3067  for (const auto chain : path_state_->Chains(path)) {
3068  change_size += chain.NumNodes();
3069  }
3070  }
3071  if (current_layer_size + change_size <= maximum_partial_demand_layer_size_) {
3072  IncrementalCommit();
3073  } else {
3074  FullCommit();
3075  }
3076 }
3077 
3078 void UnaryDimensionChecker::IncrementalCommit() {
3079  for (const int path : path_state_->ChangedPaths()) {
3080  const int begin_index = partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0].size();
3081  AppendPathDemandsToSums(path);
3082  UpdateRMQStructure(begin_index, partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0].size());
3083  }
3084 }
3085 
3086 void UnaryDimensionChecker::FullCommit() {
3087  // Clear all structures.
3088  previous_nontrivial_index_.clear();
3089  for (auto& sums : partial_demand_sums_rmq_) sums.clear();
3090  // Append all paths.
3091  const int num_paths = path_state_->NumPaths();
3092  for (int path = 0; path < num_paths; ++path) {
3093  const int begin_index = partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0].size();
3094  AppendPathDemandsToSums(path);
3095  UpdateRMQStructure(begin_index, partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0].size());
3096  }
3097 }
3098 
3099 void UnaryDimensionChecker::AppendPathDemandsToSums(int path) {
3100  const int path_class = path_class_[path];
3101  Interval demand_sum = {0, 0};
3102  int previous_nontrivial_index = -1;
3103  int index = partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0].size();
3104  // Value of partial_demand_sums_rmq_ at node_index-1 must be the sum
3105  // of all demands of nodes before node.
3106  partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0].push_back(demand_sum);
3107  previous_nontrivial_index_.push_back(-1);
3108  ++index;
3109 
3110  for (const int node : path_state_->Nodes(path)) {
3111  index_[node] = index;
3112  const Interval demand = demand_[path_class][node];
3113  demand_sum = {CapAdd(demand_sum.min, demand.min),
3114  CapAdd(demand_sum.max, demand.max)};
3115  partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0].push_back(demand_sum);
3116 
3117  const Interval node_capacity = node_capacity_[node];
3118  if (demand.min != demand.max ||
3119  node_capacity.min != std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min() ||
3120  node_capacity.max != std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max()) {
3121  previous_nontrivial_index = index;
3122  }
3123  previous_nontrivial_index_.push_back(previous_nontrivial_index);
3124  ++index;
3125  }
3126 }
3127 
3128 void UnaryDimensionChecker::UpdateRMQStructure(int begin_index, int end_index) {
3129  // The max layer is the one used by
3130  // GetMinMaxPartialDemandSum(begin_index, end_index - 1).
3131  const int maximum_rmq_exponent =
3132  MostSignificantBitPosition32(end_index - 1 - begin_index);
3133  for (int layer = 1, window_size = 1; layer <= maximum_rmq_exponent;
3134  ++layer, window_size *= 2) {
3135  partial_demand_sums_rmq_[layer].resize(end_index);
3136  for (int i = begin_index; i < end_index - window_size; ++i) {
3137  const Interval i1 = partial_demand_sums_rmq_[layer - 1][i];
3138  const Interval i2 = partial_demand_sums_rmq_[layer - 1][i + window_size];
3139  partial_demand_sums_rmq_[layer][i] = {std::min(i1.min, i2.min),
3140  std::max(i1.max, i2.max)};
3141  }
3142  std::copy(
3143  partial_demand_sums_rmq_[layer - 1].begin() + end_index - window_size,
3144  partial_demand_sums_rmq_[layer - 1].begin() + end_index,
3145  partial_demand_sums_rmq_[layer].begin() + end_index - window_size);
3146  }
3147 }
3148 
3149 // TODO(user): since this is called only when
3150 // last_node_index - first_node_index is large enough,
3151 // the lower layers of partial_demand_sums_rmq_ are never used.
3152 // For instance, if this is only called when the range size is > 4
3153 // and paths are <= 32 nodes long, then we only need layers 0, 2, 3, and 4.
3154 // To compare, on a 512 < #nodes <= 1024 problem, this uses layers in [0, 10].
3155 UnaryDimensionChecker::Interval
3156 UnaryDimensionChecker::GetMinMaxPartialDemandSum(int first_node_index,
3157  int last_node_index) const {
3158  DCHECK_LE(0, first_node_index);
3159  DCHECK_LT(first_node_index, last_node_index);
3160  DCHECK_LT(last_node_index, partial_demand_sums_rmq_[0].size());
3161  // Find largest window_size = 2^layer such that
3162  // first_node_index < last_node_index - window_size + 1.
3163  const int layer =
3164  MostSignificantBitPosition32(last_node_index - first_node_index);
3165  const int window_size = 1 << layer;
3166  // Classical range min/max query in O(1).
3167  const Interval i1 = partial_demand_sums_rmq_[layer][first_node_index];
3168  const Interval i2 =
3169  partial_demand_sums_rmq_[layer][last_node_index - window_size + 1];
3170  return {std::min(i1.min, i2.min), std::max(i1.max, i2.max)};
3171 }
3172 
3173 bool UnaryDimensionChecker::SubpathOnlyHasTrivialNodes(
3174  int first_node_index, int last_node_index) const {
3175  DCHECK_LE(0, first_node_index);
3176  DCHECK_LT(first_node_index, last_node_index);
3177  DCHECK_LT(last_node_index, previous_nontrivial_index_.size());
3178  return first_node_index > previous_nontrivial_index_[last_node_index];
3179 }

3227 bool VariableDomainFilter::Accept(const Assignment* delta,
3228  const Assignment* deltadelta,
3229  int64_t objective_min,
3230  int64_t objective_max) {
3231  const Assignment::IntContainer& container = delta->IntVarContainer();
3232  const int size = container.Size();
3233  for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3234  const IntVarElement& element = container.Element(i);
3235  if (element.Activated() && !element.Var()->Contains(element.Value())) {
3236  return false;
3237  }
3238  }
3239  return true;
3240 }

3249 const int IntVarLocalSearchFilter::kUnassigned = -1;
3250 
3251 IntVarLocalSearchFilter::IntVarLocalSearchFilter(
3252  const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars) {
3253  AddVars(vars);
3254 }
3255 
3256 void IntVarLocalSearchFilter::AddVars(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars) {
3257  if (!vars.empty()) {
3258  for (int i = 0; i < vars.size(); ++i) {
3259  const int index = vars[i]->index();
3260  if (index >= var_index_to_index_.size()) {
3261  var_index_to_index_.resize(index + 1, kUnassigned);
3262  }
3263  var_index_to_index_[index] = i + vars_.size();
3264  }
3265  vars_.insert(vars_.end(), vars.begin(), vars.end());
3266  values_.resize(vars_.size(), /*junk*/ 0);
3267  var_synced_.resize(vars_.size(), false);
3268  }
3269 }
3270 
3271 IntVarLocalSearchFilter::~IntVarLocalSearchFilter() {}
3272 
3273 void IntVarLocalSearchFilter::Synchronize(const Assignment* assignment,
3274  const Assignment* delta) {
3275  if (delta == nullptr || delta->Empty()) {
3276  var_synced_.assign(var_synced_.size(), false);
3277  SynchronizeOnAssignment(assignment);
3278  } else {
3279  SynchronizeOnAssignment(delta);
3280  }
3281  OnSynchronize(delta);
3282 }
3283 
3284 void IntVarLocalSearchFilter::SynchronizeOnAssignment(
3285  const Assignment* assignment) {
3286  const Assignment::IntContainer& container = assignment->IntVarContainer();
3287  const int size = container.Size();
3288  for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3289  const IntVarElement& element = container.Element(i);
3290  IntVar* const var = element.Var();
3291  if (var != nullptr) {
3292  if (i < vars_.size() && vars_[i] == var) {
3293  values_[i] = element.Value();
3294  var_synced_[i] = true;
3295  } else {
3296  const int64_t kUnallocated = -1;
3297  int64_t index = kUnallocated;
3298  if (FindIndex(var, &index)) {
3299  values_[index] = element.Value();
3300  var_synced_[index] = true;
3301  }
3302  }
3303  }
3304  }
3305 }
3306 
3307 // ----- Sum Objective filter ------
3308 // Maintains the sum of costs of variables, where the subclass implements
3309 // CostOfSynchronizedVariable() and FillCostOfBoundDeltaVariable() to compute
3310 // the cost of a variable depending on its value.
3311 // An assignment is accepted by this filter if the total cost is allowed
3312 // depending on the relation defined by filter_enum:
3313 // - Solver::LE -> total_cost <= objective_max.
3314 // - Solver::GE -> total_cost >= objective_min.
3315 // - Solver::EQ -> the conjunction of LE and GE.
3316 namespace {
3317 class SumObjectiveFilter : public IntVarLocalSearchFilter {
3318  public:
3319  SumObjectiveFilter(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
3320  Solver::LocalSearchFilterBound filter_enum)
3321  : IntVarLocalSearchFilter(vars),
3322  primary_vars_size_(vars.size()),
3323  synchronized_costs_(new int64_t[vars.size()]),
3324  delta_costs_(new int64_t[vars.size()]),
3325  filter_enum_(filter_enum),
3326  synchronized_sum_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()),
3327  delta_sum_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()),
3328  incremental_(false) {
3329  for (int i = 0; i < vars.size(); ++i) {
3330  synchronized_costs_[i] = 0;
3331  delta_costs_[i] = 0;
3332  }
3333  }
3334  ~SumObjectiveFilter() override {
3335  delete[] synchronized_costs_;
3336  delete[] delta_costs_;
3337  }
3338  bool Accept(const Assignment* delta, const Assignment* deltadelta,
3339  int64_t objective_min, int64_t objective_max) override {
3340  if (delta == nullptr) {
3341  return false;
3342  }
3343  if (deltadelta->Empty()) {
3344  if (incremental_) {
3345  for (int i = 0; i < primary_vars_size_; ++i) {
3346  delta_costs_[i] = synchronized_costs_[i];
3347  }
3348  delta_sum_ = synchronized_sum_;
3349  }
3350  incremental_ = false;
3351  delta_sum_ = CapAdd(synchronized_sum_,
3352  CostOfChanges(delta, synchronized_costs_, false));
3353  } else {
3354  if (incremental_) {
3355  delta_sum_ =
3356  CapAdd(delta_sum_, CostOfChanges(deltadelta, delta_costs_, true));
3357  } else {
3358  delta_sum_ = CapAdd(synchronized_sum_,
3359  CostOfChanges(delta, synchronized_costs_, true));
3360  }
3361  incremental_ = true;
3362  }
3363  switch (filter_enum_) {
3364  case Solver::LE: {
3365  return delta_sum_ <= objective_max;
3366  }
3367  case Solver::GE: {
3368  return delta_sum_ >= objective_min;
3369  }
3370  case Solver::EQ: {
3371  return objective_min <= delta_sum_ && delta_sum_ <= objective_max;
3372  }
3373  default: {
3374  LOG(ERROR) << "Unknown local search filter enum value";
3375  return false;
3376  }
3377  }
3378  }
3379  // If the variable is synchronized, returns its associated cost, otherwise
3380  // returns 0.
3381  virtual int64_t CostOfSynchronizedVariable(int64_t index) = 0;
3382  // If the variable is bound, fills new_cost with the cost associated to the
3383  // variable's valuation in container, and returns true. Otherwise, fills
3384  // new_cost with 0, and returns false.
3385  virtual bool FillCostOfBoundDeltaVariable(
3386  const Assignment::IntContainer& container, int index,
3387  int* container_index, int64_t* new_cost) = 0;
3388  bool IsIncremental() const override { return true; }
3389 
3390  std::string DebugString() const override { return "SumObjectiveFilter"; }
3391 
3392  int64_t GetSynchronizedObjectiveValue() const override {
3393  return synchronized_sum_;
3394  }
3395  int64_t GetAcceptedObjectiveValue() const override { return delta_sum_; }
3396 
3397  protected:
3398  const int primary_vars_size_;
3399  int64_t* const synchronized_costs_;
3400  int64_t* const delta_costs_;
3401  Solver::LocalSearchFilterBound filter_enum_;
3402  int64_t synchronized_sum_;
3403  int64_t delta_sum_;
3404  bool incremental_;
3405 
3406  private:
3407  void OnSynchronize(const Assignment* delta) override {
3408  synchronized_sum_ = 0;
3409  for (int i = 0; i < primary_vars_size_; ++i) {
3410  const int64_t cost = CostOfSynchronizedVariable(i);
3411  synchronized_costs_[i] = cost;
3412  delta_costs_[i] = cost;
3413  synchronized_sum_ = CapAdd(synchronized_sum_, cost);
3414  }
3415  delta_sum_ = synchronized_sum_;
3416  incremental_ = false;
3417  }
3418  int64_t CostOfChanges(const Assignment* changes,
3419  const int64_t* const old_costs,
3420  bool cache_delta_values) {
3421  int64_t total_cost = 0;
3422  const Assignment::IntContainer& container = changes->IntVarContainer();
3423  const int size = container.Size();
3424  for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3425  const IntVarElement& new_element = container.Element(i);
3426  IntVar* const var = new_element.Var();
3427  int64_t index = -1;
3428  if (FindIndex(var, &index) && index < primary_vars_size_) {
3429  total_cost = CapSub(total_cost, old_costs[index]);
3430  int64_t new_cost = 0LL;
3431  if (FillCostOfBoundDeltaVariable(container, index, &i, &new_cost)) {
3432  total_cost = CapAdd(total_cost, new_cost);
3433  }
3434  if (cache_delta_values) {
3435  delta_costs_[index] = new_cost;
3436  }
3437  }
3438  }
3439  return total_cost;
3440  }
3441 };
3442 
3443 class BinaryObjectiveFilter : public SumObjectiveFilter {
3444  public:
3445  BinaryObjectiveFilter(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
3446  Solver::IndexEvaluator2 value_evaluator,
3447  Solver::LocalSearchFilterBound filter_enum)
3448  : SumObjectiveFilter(vars, filter_enum),
3449  value_evaluator_(std::move(value_evaluator)) {}
3450  ~BinaryObjectiveFilter() override {}
3451  int64_t CostOfSynchronizedVariable(int64_t index) override {
3452  return IntVarLocalSearchFilter::IsVarSynced(index)
3453  ? value_evaluator_(index, IntVarLocalSearchFilter::Value(index))
3454  : 0;
3455  }
3456  bool FillCostOfBoundDeltaVariable(const Assignment::IntContainer& container,
3457  int index, int* container_index,
3458  int64_t* new_cost) override {
3459  const IntVarElement& element = container.Element(*container_index);
3460  if (element.Activated()) {
3461  *new_cost = value_evaluator_(index, element.Value());
3462  return true;
3463  }
3464  const IntVar* var = element.Var();
3465  if (var->Bound()) {
3466  *new_cost = value_evaluator_(index, var->Min());
3467  return true;
3468  }
3469  *new_cost = 0;
3470  return false;
3471  }
3472 
3473  private:
3474  Solver::IndexEvaluator2 value_evaluator_;
3475 };

3477 class TernaryObjectiveFilter : public SumObjectiveFilter {
3478  public:
3479  TernaryObjectiveFilter(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
3480  const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
3481  Solver::IndexEvaluator3 value_evaluator,
3482  Solver::LocalSearchFilterBound filter_enum)
3483  : SumObjectiveFilter(vars, filter_enum),
3484  secondary_vars_offset_(vars.size()),
3485  value_evaluator_(std::move(value_evaluator)) {
3486  IntVarLocalSearchFilter::AddVars(secondary_vars);
3487  CHECK_GE(IntVarLocalSearchFilter::Size(), 0);
3488  }
3489  ~TernaryObjectiveFilter() override {}
3490  int64_t CostOfSynchronizedVariable(int64_t index) override {
3491  DCHECK_LT(index, secondary_vars_offset_);
3492  return IntVarLocalSearchFilter::IsVarSynced(index)
3493  ? value_evaluator_(index, IntVarLocalSearchFilter::Value(index),
3494  IntVarLocalSearchFilter::Value(
3495  index + secondary_vars_offset_))
3496  : 0;
3497  }
3498  bool FillCostOfBoundDeltaVariable(const Assignment::IntContainer& container,
3499  int index, int* container_index,
3500  int64_t* new_cost) override {
3501  DCHECK_LT(index, secondary_vars_offset_);
3502  *new_cost = 0LL;
3503  const IntVarElement& element = container.Element(*container_index);
3504  const IntVar* secondary_var =
3505  IntVarLocalSearchFilter::Var(index + secondary_vars_offset_);
3506  if (element.Activated()) {
3507  const int64_t value = element.Value();
3508  int hint_index = *container_index + 1;
3509  if (hint_index < container.Size() &&
3510  secondary_var == container.Element(hint_index).Var()) {
3511  *new_cost = value_evaluator_(index, value,
3512  container.Element(hint_index).Value());
3513  *container_index = hint_index;
3514  } else {
3515  *new_cost = value_evaluator_(index, value,
3516  container.Element(secondary_var).Value());
3517  }
3518  return true;
3519  }
3520  const IntVar* var = element.Var();
3521  if (var->Bound() && secondary_var->Bound()) {
3522  *new_cost = value_evaluator_(index, var->Min(), secondary_var->Min());
3523  return true;
3524  }
3525  *new_cost = 0;
3526  return false;
3527  }
3528 
3529  private:
3530  int secondary_vars_offset_;
3531  Solver::IndexEvaluator3 value_evaluator_;

3550 LocalSearchVariable LocalSearchState::AddVariable(int64_t initial_min,
3551  int64_t initial_max) {
3552  DCHECK(state_is_valid_);
3553  DCHECK_LE(initial_min, initial_max);
3554  initial_variable_bounds_.push_back({initial_min, initial_max});
3555  variable_bounds_.push_back({initial_min, initial_max});
3556  variable_is_relaxed_.push_back(false);
3557 
3558  const int variable_index = variable_bounds_.size() - 1;
3559  return {this, variable_index};
3560 }
3561 
3562 void LocalSearchState::RelaxVariableBounds(int variable_index) {
3563  DCHECK(state_is_valid_);
3564  DCHECK(0 <= variable_index && variable_index < variable_is_relaxed_.size());
3565  if (!variable_is_relaxed_[variable_index]) {
3566  variable_is_relaxed_[variable_index] = true;
3567  saved_variable_bounds_trail_.emplace_back(variable_bounds_[variable_index],
3568  variable_index);
3569  variable_bounds_[variable_index] = initial_variable_bounds_[variable_index];
3570  }
3571 }

3574  DCHECK(state_is_valid_);
3575  DCHECK(0 <= variable_index && variable_index < variable_bounds_.size());
3576  return variable_bounds_[variable_index].min;
3577 }

3579 int64_t LocalSearchState::VariableMax(int variable_index) const {
3580  DCHECK(state_is_valid_);
3581  DCHECK(0 <= variable_index && variable_index < variable_bounds_.size());
3582  return variable_bounds_[variable_index].max;
3583 }

3585 bool LocalSearchState::TightenVariableMin(int variable_index,
3586  int64_t min_value) {
3587  DCHECK(state_is_valid_);
3588  DCHECK(variable_is_relaxed_[variable_index]);
3589  DCHECK(0 <= variable_index && variable_index < variable_bounds_.size());
3590  Bounds& bounds = variable_bounds_[variable_index];
3591  if (bounds.max < min_value) {
3592  state_is_valid_ = false;
3593  }
3594  bounds.min = std::max(bounds.min, min_value);
3595  return state_is_valid_;
3596 }
3597 
3598 bool LocalSearchState::TightenVariableMax(int variable_index,
3599  int64_t max_value) {
3600  DCHECK(state_is_valid_);
3601  DCHECK(variable_is_relaxed_[variable_index]);
3602  DCHECK(0 <= variable_index && variable_index < variable_bounds_.size());
3603  Bounds& bounds = variable_bounds_[variable_index];
3604  if (bounds.min > max_value) {
3605  state_is_valid_ = false;
3606  }
3607  bounds.max = std::min(bounds.max, max_value);
3608  return state_is_valid_;
3609 }

3611 // TODO(user): When the class has more users, find a threshold ratio of
3612 // saved/total variables under which a sparse clear would be more efficient
3613 // for both Commit() and Revert().
3614 void LocalSearchState::Commit() {
3615  DCHECK(state_is_valid_);
3616  saved_variable_bounds_trail_.clear();
3617  variable_is_relaxed_.assign(variable_is_relaxed_.size(), false);
3618 }
3619 
3620 void LocalSearchState::Revert() {
3621  for (const auto& bounds_index : saved_variable_bounds_trail_) {
3622  DCHECK(variable_is_relaxed_[bounds_index.second]);
3623  variable_bounds_[bounds_index.second] = bounds_index.first;
3624  }
3625  saved_variable_bounds_trail_.clear();
3626  variable_is_relaxed_.assign(variable_is_relaxed_.size(), false);
3627  state_is_valid_ = true;
3628 }

3632 class LocalSearchProfiler : public LocalSearchMonitor {
3633  public:
3634  explicit LocalSearchProfiler(Solver* solver) : LocalSearchMonitor(solver) {}
3635  std::string DebugString() const override { return "LocalSearchProfiler"; }
3636  void RestartSearch() override {
3637  operator_stats_.clear();
3638  filter_stats_.clear();
3639  }
3640  void ExitSearch() override {
3641  // Update times for current operator when the search ends.
3642  if (solver()->TopLevelSearch() == solver()->ActiveSearch()) {

3646  LocalSearchStatistics ExportToLocalSearchStatistics() const {
3647  LocalSearchStatistics statistics_proto;
3648  std::vector<const LocalSearchOperator*> operators;
3649  for (const auto& stat : operator_stats_) {
3650  operators.push_back(stat.first);
3651  }
3652  std::sort(
3653  operators.begin(), operators.end(),
3654  [this](const LocalSearchOperator* op1, const LocalSearchOperator* op2) {
3655  return gtl::FindOrDie(operator_stats_, op1).neighbors >
3656  gtl::FindOrDie(operator_stats_, op2).neighbors;
3657  });
3658  for (const LocalSearchOperator* const op : operators) {
3659  const OperatorStats& stats = gtl::FindOrDie(operator_stats_, op);
3660  LocalSearchStatistics::LocalSearchOperatorStatistics* const
3661  local_search_operator_statistics =
3662  statistics_proto.add_local_search_operator_statistics();
3663  local_search_operator_statistics->set_local_search_operator(
3664  op->DebugString());
3665  local_search_operator_statistics->set_num_neighbors(stats.neighbors);
3666  local_search_operator_statistics->set_num_filtered_neighbors(
3667  stats.filtered_neighbors);
3668  local_search_operator_statistics->set_num_accepted_neighbors(
3669  stats.accepted_neighbors);
3670  local_search_operator_statistics->set_duration_seconds(stats.seconds);
3671  }
3672  std::vector<const LocalSearchFilter*> filters;
3673  for (const auto& stat : filter_stats_) {
3674  filters.push_back(stat.first);
3675  }
3676  std::sort(filters.begin(), filters.end(),
3677  [this](const LocalSearchFilter* filter1,
3678  const LocalSearchFilter* filter2) {
3679  return gtl::FindOrDie(filter_stats_, filter1).calls >
3680  gtl::FindOrDie(filter_stats_, filter2).calls;
3681  });
3682  for (const LocalSearchFilter* const filter : filters) {
3683  const FilterStats& stats = gtl::FindOrDie(filter_stats_, filter);
3684  LocalSearchStatistics::LocalSearchFilterStatistics* const
3685  local_search_filter_statistics =
3686  statistics_proto.add_local_search_filter_statistics();
3687  local_search_filter_statistics->set_local_search_filter(
3688  filter->DebugString());
3689  local_search_filter_statistics->set_num_calls(stats.calls);
3690  local_search_filter_statistics->set_num_rejects(stats.rejects);
3691  local_search_filter_statistics->set_duration_seconds(stats.seconds);
3692  }
3693  statistics_proto.set_total_num_neighbors(solver()->neighbors());
3694  statistics_proto.set_total_num_filtered_neighbors(
3695  solver()->filtered_neighbors());
3696  statistics_proto.set_total_num_accepted_neighbors(
3697  solver()->accepted_neighbors());
3698  return statistics_proto;
3699  }
3700  std::string PrintOverview() const {
3701  size_t max_name_size = 0;
3702  std::vector<const LocalSearchOperator*> operators;
3703  for (const auto& stat : operator_stats_) {
3704  operators.push_back(stat.first);
3705  max_name_size =
3706  std::max(max_name_size, stat.first->DebugString().length());
3707  }
3708  std::sort(
3709  operators.begin(), operators.end(),
3710  [this](const LocalSearchOperator* op1, const LocalSearchOperator* op2) {
3711  return gtl::FindOrDie(operator_stats_, op1).neighbors >
3712  gtl::FindOrDie(operator_stats_, op2).neighbors;
3713  });
3714  std::string overview = "Local search operator statistics:\n";
3715  absl::StrAppendFormat(&overview,
3716  "%*s | Neighbors | Filtered | Accepted | Time (s)\n",
3717  max_name_size, "");
3718  OperatorStats total_stats;
3719  for (const LocalSearchOperator* const op : operators) {
3720  const OperatorStats& stats = gtl::FindOrDie(operator_stats_, op);
3721  const std::string& name = op->DebugString();
3722  absl::StrAppendFormat(&overview, "%*s | %9ld | %8ld | %8ld | %7.2g\n",
3723  max_name_size, name, stats.neighbors,
3724  stats.filtered_neighbors, stats.accepted_neighbors,
3725  stats.seconds);
3726  total_stats.neighbors += stats.neighbors;
3727  total_stats.filtered_neighbors += stats.filtered_neighbors;
3728  total_stats.accepted_neighbors += stats.accepted_neighbors;
3729  total_stats.seconds += stats.seconds;
3730  }
3731  absl::StrAppendFormat(&overview, "%*s | %9ld | %8ld | %8ld | %7.2g\n",
3732  max_name_size, "Total", total_stats.neighbors,
3733  total_stats.filtered_neighbors,
3734  total_stats.accepted_neighbors, total_stats.seconds);
3735  max_name_size = 0;
3736  std::vector<const LocalSearchFilter*> filters;
3737  for (const auto& stat : filter_stats_) {
3738  filters.push_back(stat.first);
3739  max_name_size =
3740  std::max(max_name_size, stat.first->DebugString().length());
3741  }
3742  std::sort(filters.begin(), filters.end(),
3743  [this](const LocalSearchFilter* filter1,
3744  const LocalSearchFilter* filter2) {
3745  return gtl::FindOrDie(filter_stats_, filter1).calls >
3746  gtl::FindOrDie(filter_stats_, filter2).calls;
3747  });
3748  absl::StrAppendFormat(&overview,
3749  "Local search filter statistics:\n%*s | Calls | "
3750  " Rejects | Time (s) "
3751  "| Rejects/s\n",
3752  max_name_size, "");
3753  FilterStats total_filter_stats;
3754  for (const LocalSearchFilter* const filter : filters) {
3755  const FilterStats& stats = gtl::FindOrDie(filter_stats_, filter);
3756  const std::string& name = filter->DebugString();
3757  absl::StrAppendFormat(&overview, "%*s | %9ld | %9ld | %7.2g | %7.2g\n",
3758  max_name_size, name, stats.calls, stats.rejects,
3759  stats.seconds, stats.rejects / stats.seconds);
3760  total_filter_stats.calls += stats.calls;
3761  total_filter_stats.rejects += stats.rejects;
3762  total_filter_stats.seconds += stats.seconds;
3763  }
3764  absl::StrAppendFormat(
3765  &overview, "%*s | %9ld | %9ld | %7.2g | %7.2g\n", max_name_size,
3766  "Total", total_filter_stats.calls, total_filter_stats.rejects,
3767  total_filter_stats.seconds,
3768  total_filter_stats.rejects / total_filter_stats.seconds);
3769  return overview;
3770  }
3771  void BeginOperatorStart() override {}
3772  void EndOperatorStart() override {}
3773  void BeginMakeNextNeighbor(const LocalSearchOperator* op) override {
3774  if (last_operator_ != op->Self()) {
3775  UpdateTime();
3776  last_operator_ = op->Self();
3777  }
3778  }
3779  void EndMakeNextNeighbor(const LocalSearchOperator* op, bool neighbor_found,
3780  const Assignment* delta,
3781  const Assignment* deltadelta) override {
3782  if (neighbor_found) {
3783  operator_stats_[op->Self()].neighbors++;
3784  }
3785  }
3786  void BeginFilterNeighbor(const LocalSearchOperator* op) override {}
3787  void EndFilterNeighbor(const LocalSearchOperator* op,
3788  bool neighbor_found) override {
3789  if (neighbor_found) {
3790  operator_stats_[op->Self()].filtered_neighbors++;
3791  }
3792  }
3793  void BeginAcceptNeighbor(const LocalSearchOperator* op) override {}
3794  void EndAcceptNeighbor(const LocalSearchOperator* op,
3795  bool neighbor_found) override {
3796  if (neighbor_found) {
3797  operator_stats_[op->Self()].accepted_neighbors++;
3798  }
3799  }
3800  void BeginFiltering(const LocalSearchFilter* filter) override {
3801  filter_stats_[filter].calls++;
3802  filter_timer_.Start();
3803  }
3804  void EndFiltering(const LocalSearchFilter* filter, bool reject) override {
3805  filter_timer_.Stop();
3806  auto& stats = filter_stats_[filter];
3807  stats.seconds += filter_timer_.Get();
3808  if (reject) {
3809  stats.rejects++;
3810  }
3811  }
3812  void Install() override { SearchMonitor::Install(); }
3813 
3814  private:
3815  void UpdateTime() {
3816  if (last_operator_ != nullptr) {
3817  timer_.Stop();
3818  operator_stats_[last_operator_].seconds += timer_.Get();
3819  }
3820  timer_.Start();
3821  }

3833  double seconds = 0;

3835  WallTimer timer_;
3836  WallTimer filter_timer_;
3837  const LocalSearchOperator* last_operator_ = nullptr;
3838  absl::flat_hash_map<const LocalSearchOperator*, OperatorStats>
3839  operator_stats_;
3840  absl::flat_hash_map<const LocalSearchFilter*, FilterStats> filter_stats_;
3841 };

3870 void LocalSearchFilterManager::InitializeForcedEvents() {
3871  const int num_events = filter_events_.size();
3872  int next_forced_event = num_events;
3873  next_forced_events_.resize(num_events);
3874  for (int i = num_events - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
3875  next_forced_events_[i] = next_forced_event;
3876  if (filter_events_[i].filter->IsIncremental() ||
3877  (filter_events_[i].event_type == FilterEventType::kRelax &&
3878  next_forced_event != num_events)) {
3879  next_forced_event = i;
3880  }
3881  }
3882 }
3883 
3884 LocalSearchFilterManager::LocalSearchFilterManager(
3885  std::vector<LocalSearchFilter*> filters)
3886  : synchronized_value_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()),
3887  accepted_value_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()) {
3888  filter_events_.reserve(2 * filters.size());
3889  for (LocalSearchFilter* filter : filters) {
3890  filter_events_.push_back({filter, FilterEventType::kRelax});
3891  }
3892  for (LocalSearchFilter* filter : filters) {
3893  filter_events_.push_back({filter, FilterEventType::kAccept});
3894  }
3895  InitializeForcedEvents();
3896 }
3897 
3898 LocalSearchFilterManager::LocalSearchFilterManager(
3899  std::vector<FilterEvent> filter_events)
3900  : filter_events_(std::move(filter_events)),
3901  synchronized_value_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()),
3902  accepted_value_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()) {
3903  InitializeForcedEvents();
3904 }
3905 
3906 // Filters' Revert() must be called in the reverse order in which their
3907 // Relax() was called.
3908 void LocalSearchFilterManager::Revert() {
3909  for (int i = last_event_called_; i >= 0; --i) {
3910  auto [filter, event_type] = filter_events_[i];
3911  if (event_type == FilterEventType::kRelax) filter->Revert();
3912  }
3913  last_event_called_ = -1;
3914 }
3915 
3916 // TODO(user): the behaviour of Accept relies on the initial order of
3917 // filters having at most one filter with negative objective values,
3918 // this could be fixed by having filters return their general bounds.
3919 bool LocalSearchFilterManager::Accept(LocalSearchMonitor* const monitor,
3920  const Assignment* delta,
3921  const Assignment* deltadelta,
3922  int64_t objective_min,
3923  int64_t objective_max) {
3924  Revert();
3925  accepted_value_ = 0;
3926  bool ok = true;
3927  const int num_events = filter_events_.size();
3928  for (int i = 0; i < num_events;) {
3929  last_event_called_ = i;
3930  auto [filter, event_type] = filter_events_[last_event_called_];
3931  switch (event_type) {
3932  case FilterEventType::kAccept: {
3933  if (monitor != nullptr) monitor->BeginFiltering(filter);
3934  const bool accept = filter->Accept(
3935  delta, deltadelta, CapSub(objective_min, accepted_value_),
3936  CapSub(objective_max, accepted_value_));
3937  ok &= accept;
3938  if (monitor != nullptr) monitor->EndFiltering(filter, !accept);
3939  if (ok) {
3940  accepted_value_ =
3941  CapAdd(accepted_value_, filter->GetAcceptedObjectiveValue());
3942  // TODO(user): handle objective min.
3943  ok = accepted_value_ <= objective_max;
3944  }
3945  break;
3946  }
3947  case FilterEventType::kRelax: {
3948  filter->Relax(delta, deltadelta);
3949  break;
3950  }
3951  default:
3952  LOG(FATAL) << "Unknown filter event type.";
3953  }
3954  // If the candidate is rejected, forced events must still be called.
3955  if (ok) {
3956  ++i;
3957  } else {
3958  i = next_forced_events_[i];
3959  }
3960  }
3961  return ok;
3962 }
3963 
3964 void LocalSearchFilterManager::Synchronize(const Assignment* assignment,
3965  const Assignment* delta) {
3966  // If delta is nullptr or empty, then assignment may be a partial solution.
3967  // Send a signal to Relaxing filters to inform them,
3968  // so they can show the partial solution as a change from the empty solution.
3969  const bool reset_to_assignment = delta == nullptr || delta->Empty();
3970  // Relax in the forward direction.
3971  for (auto [filter, event_type] : filter_events_) {
3972  switch (event_type) {
3973  case FilterEventType::kAccept: {
3974  break;
3975  }
3976  case FilterEventType::kRelax: {
3977  if (reset_to_assignment) {
3978  filter->Reset();
3979  filter->Relax(assignment, nullptr);
3980  } else {
3981  filter->Relax(delta, nullptr);
3982  }
3983  break;
3984  }
3985  default:
3986  LOG(FATAL) << "Unknown filter event type.";
3987  }
3988  }
3989  // Synchronize/Commit backwards, so filters can read changes from their
3990  // dependencies before those are synchronized/committed.
3991  synchronized_value_ = 0;
3992  for (auto [filter, event_type] : ::gtl::reversed_view(filter_events_)) {
3993  switch (event_type) {
3994  case FilterEventType::kAccept: {
3995  filter->Synchronize(assignment, delta);
3996  synchronized_value_ = CapAdd(synchronized_value_,
3997  filter->GetSynchronizedObjectiveValue());
3998  break;
3999  }
4000  case FilterEventType::kRelax: {
4001  filter->Commit(assignment, delta);
4002  break;
4003  }
4004  default:
4005  LOG(FATAL) << "Unknown filter event type.";
4006  }
4007  }
4008 }
4009

4011 
4012 class FindOneNeighbor : public DecisionBuilder {
4013  public:
4014  FindOneNeighbor(Assignment* const assignment, IntVar* objective,
4015  SolutionPool* const pool,
4016  LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator,
4017  DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder,
4018  const RegularLimit* const limit,
4019  LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager);
4020  ~FindOneNeighbor() override {}
4021  Decision* Next(Solver* const solver) override;
4022  std::string DebugString() const override { return "FindOneNeighbor"; }
4023 
4024  private:
4025  bool FilterAccept(Solver* solver, Assignment* delta, Assignment* deltadelta,
4026  int64_t objective_min, int64_t objective_max);
4027  void SynchronizeAll(Solver* solver);
4028 
4029  Assignment* const assignment_;
4030  IntVar* const objective_;
4031  std::unique_ptr<Assignment> reference_assignment_;
4032  SolutionPool* const pool_;
4033  LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator_;
4034  DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder_;
4035  RegularLimit* limit_;
4036  const RegularLimit* const original_limit_;
4037  bool neighbor_found_;
4038  LocalSearchFilterManager* const filter_manager_;
4039  int64_t solutions_since_last_check_;
4040  int64_t check_period_;
4041  Assignment last_checked_assignment_;
4042  bool has_checked_assignment_ = false;
4043 };
4044 
4045 // reference_assignment_ is used to keep track of the last assignment on which
4046 // operators were started, assignment_ corresponding to the last successful
4047 // neighbor.
4048 FindOneNeighbor::FindOneNeighbor(Assignment* const assignment,
4049  IntVar* objective, SolutionPool* const pool,
4050  LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator,
4051  DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder,
4052  const RegularLimit* const limit,
4053  LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager)
4054  : assignment_(assignment),
4055  objective_(objective),
4056  reference_assignment_(new Assignment(assignment_)),
4057  pool_(pool),
4058  ls_operator_(ls_operator),
4059  sub_decision_builder_(sub_decision_builder),
4060  limit_(nullptr),
4061  original_limit_(limit),
4062  neighbor_found_(false),
4063  filter_manager_(filter_manager),
4064  solutions_since_last_check_(0),
4065  check_period_(
4066  assignment_->solver()->parameters().check_solution_period()),
4067  last_checked_assignment_(assignment) {
4068  CHECK(nullptr != assignment);
4069  CHECK(nullptr != ls_operator);
4070 
4071  Solver* const solver = assignment_->solver();
4072  // If limit is nullptr, default limit is 1 solution
4073  if (nullptr == limit) {
4074  limit_ = solver->MakeSolutionsLimit(1);
4075  } else {
4076  limit_ = limit->MakeIdenticalClone();
4077  // TODO(user): Support skipping neighborhood checks for limits accepting
4078  // more than one solution (e.g. best accept). For now re-enabling systematic
4079  // checks.
4080  if (limit_->solutions() != 1) {
4081  VLOG(1) << "Disabling neighbor-check skipping outside of first accept.";
4082  check_period_ = 1;
4083  }
4084  }
4085  // TODO(user): Support skipping neighborhood checks with LNS (at least on
4086  // the non-LNS operators).
4087  if (ls_operator->HasFragments()) {
4088  VLOG(1) << "Disabling neighbor-check skipping for LNS.";
4089  check_period_ = 1;
4090  }
4091 
4092  if (!reference_assignment_->HasObjective()) {
4093  reference_assignment_->AddObjective(objective_);
4094  }
4095 }
4096 
4097 Decision* FindOneNeighbor::Next(Solver* const solver) {
4098  CHECK(nullptr != solver);
4099 
4100  if (original_limit_ != nullptr) {
4101  limit_->Copy(original_limit_);
4102  }
4103 
4104  if (!last_checked_assignment_.HasObjective()) {
4105  last_checked_assignment_.AddObjective(assignment_->Objective());
4106  }
4107 
4108  if (!neighbor_found_) {
4109  // Only called on the first call to Next(), reference_assignment_ has not
4110  // been synced with assignment_ yet
4111 
4112  // Keeping the code in case a performance problem forces us to
4113  // use the old code with a zero test on pool_.
4114  // reference_assignment_->CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4115  pool_->Initialize(assignment_);
4116  SynchronizeAll(solver);
4117  }
4118 
4119  {
4120  // Another assignment is needed to apply the delta
4121  Assignment* assignment_copy =
4122  solver->MakeAssignment(reference_assignment_.get());
4123  int counter = 0;
4124 
4125  DecisionBuilder* restore = solver->MakeRestoreAssignment(assignment_copy);
4126  if (sub_decision_builder_) {
4127  restore = solver->Compose(restore, sub_decision_builder_);
4128  }
4129  Assignment* delta = solver->MakeAssignment();
4130  Assignment* deltadelta = solver->MakeAssignment();
4131  while (true) {
4132  if (!ls_operator_->HoldsDelta()) {
4133  delta->Clear();
4134  }
4135  delta->ClearObjective();
4136  deltadelta->Clear();
4137  solver->TopPeriodicCheck();
4138  if (++counter >= absl::GetFlag(FLAGS_cp_local_search_sync_frequency) &&
4139  pool_->SyncNeeded(reference_assignment_.get())) {
4140  // TODO(user) : SyncNeed(assignment_) ?
4141  counter = 0;
4142  SynchronizeAll(solver);
4143  }
4144 
4145  bool has_neighbor = false;
4146  if (!limit_->Check()) {
4147  solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->BeginMakeNextNeighbor(ls_operator_);
4148  has_neighbor = ls_operator_->MakeNextNeighbor(delta, deltadelta);
4149  solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->EndMakeNextNeighbor(
4150  ls_operator_, has_neighbor, delta, deltadelta);
4151  }
4152 
4153  if (has_neighbor && !solver->IsUncheckedSolutionLimitReached()) {
4154  solver->neighbors_ += 1;
4155  // All filters must be called for incrementality reasons.
4156  // Empty deltas must also be sent to incremental filters; can be needed
4157  // to resync filters on non-incremental (empty) moves.
4158  // TODO(user): Don't call both if no filter is incremental and one
4159  // of them returned false.
4160  solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->BeginFilterNeighbor(ls_operator_);
4161  const bool mh_filter =
4162  AcceptDelta(solver->ParentSearch(), delta, deltadelta);
4163  int64_t objective_min = std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min();
4164  int64_t objective_max = std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max();
4165  if (objective_) {
4166  objective_min = objective_->Min();
4167  objective_max = objective_->Max();
4168  }
4169  if (delta->HasObjective() && delta->Objective() == objective_) {
4170  objective_min = std::max(objective_min, delta->ObjectiveMin());
4171  objective_max = std::min(objective_max, delta->ObjectiveMax());
4172  }
4173  const bool move_filter = FilterAccept(solver, delta, deltadelta,
4174  objective_min, objective_max);
4175  solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->EndFilterNeighbor(
4176  ls_operator_, mh_filter && move_filter);
4177  if (!mh_filter || !move_filter) {
4178  if (filter_manager_ != nullptr) filter_manager_->Revert();
4179  continue;
4180  }
4181  solver->filtered_neighbors_ += 1;
4182  if (delta->HasObjective()) {
4183  if (!assignment_copy->HasObjective()) {
4184  assignment_copy->AddObjective(delta->Objective());
4185  }
4186  if (!assignment_->HasObjective()) {
4187  assignment_->AddObjective(delta->Objective());
4188  last_checked_assignment_.AddObjective(delta->Objective());
4189  }
4190  }
4191  assignment_copy->CopyIntersection(reference_assignment_.get());
4192  assignment_copy->CopyIntersection(delta);
4193  solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->BeginAcceptNeighbor(ls_operator_);
4194  const bool check_solution = (solutions_since_last_check_ == 0) ||
4195  !solver->UseFastLocalSearch() ||
4196  // LNS deltas need to be restored
4197  !delta->AreAllElementsBound();
4198  if (has_checked_assignment_) solutions_since_last_check_++;
4199  if (solutions_since_last_check_ >= check_period_) {
4200  solutions_since_last_check_ = 0;
4201  }
4202  const bool accept = !check_solution || solver->SolveAndCommit(restore);
4203  solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->EndAcceptNeighbor(ls_operator_,
4204  accept);
4205  if (accept) {
4206  solver->accepted_neighbors_ += 1;
4207  if (check_solution) {
4208  solver->SetSearchContext(solver->ParentSearch(),
4209  ls_operator_->DebugString());
4210  assignment_->Store();
4211  last_checked_assignment_.CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4212  neighbor_found_ = true;
4213  has_checked_assignment_ = true;
4214  return nullptr;
4215  }
4216  solver->SetSearchContext(solver->ActiveSearch(),
4217  ls_operator_->DebugString());
4218  assignment_->CopyIntersection(assignment_copy);
4219  assignment_->SetObjectiveValue(
4220  filter_manager_ ? filter_manager_->GetAcceptedObjectiveValue()
4221  : 0);
4222  // Advancing local search to the current solution without
4223  // checking.
4224  // TODO(user): support the case were limit_ accepts more than
4225  // one solution (e.g. best accept).
4226  AcceptUncheckedNeighbor(solver->ParentSearch());
4227  solver->IncrementUncheckedSolutionCounter();
4228  pool_->RegisterNewSolution(assignment_);
4229  SynchronizeAll(solver);
4230  // NOTE: SynchronizeAll() sets neighbor_found_ to false, force it
4231  // back to true when skipping checks.
4232  neighbor_found_ = true;
4233  } else {
4234  if (filter_manager_ != nullptr) filter_manager_->Revert();
4235  if (check_period_ > 1 && has_checked_assignment_) {
4236  // Filtering is not perfect, disabling fast local search and
4237  // resynchronizing with the last checked solution.
4238  // TODO(user): Restore state of local search operators to
4239  // make sure we are exploring neighbors in the same order. This can
4240  // affect the local optimum found.
4241  VLOG(1) << "Imperfect filtering detected, backtracking to last "
4242  "checked solution and checking all solutions.";
4243  check_period_ = 1;
4244  solutions_since_last_check_ = 0;
4245  pool_->RegisterNewSolution(&last_checked_assignment_);
4246  SynchronizeAll(solver);
4247  assignment_->CopyIntersection(&last_checked_assignment_);
4248  }
4249  }
4250  } else {
4251  if (neighbor_found_) {
4252  // In case the last checked assignment isn't the current one, restore
4253  // it to make sure the solver knows about it, especially if this is
4254  // the end of the search.
4255  // TODO(user): Compare assignments in addition to their cost.
4256  if (last_checked_assignment_.ObjectiveValue() !=
4257  assignment_->ObjectiveValue()) {
4258  // If restoring fails this means filtering is not perfect and the
4259  // solver will consider the last checked assignment.
4260  assignment_copy->CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4261  if (!solver->SolveAndCommit(restore)) solver->Fail();
4262  last_checked_assignment_.CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4263  has_checked_assignment_ = true;
4264  return nullptr;
4265  }
4266  AcceptNeighbor(solver->ParentSearch());
4267  // Keeping the code in case a performance problem forces us to
4268  // use the old code with a zero test on pool_.
4269  // reference_assignment_->CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4270  pool_->RegisterNewSolution(assignment_);
4271  SynchronizeAll(solver);
4272  } else {
4273  break;
4274  }
4275  }
4276  }
4277  }
4278  solver->Fail();
4279  return nullptr;
4280 }
4281 
4282 bool FindOneNeighbor::FilterAccept(Solver* solver, Assignment* delta,
4283  Assignment* deltadelta,
4284  int64_t objective_min,
4285  int64_t objective_max) {
4286  if (filter_manager_ == nullptr) return true;
4287  LocalSearchMonitor* const monitor = solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor();
4288  return filter_manager_->Accept(monitor, delta, deltadelta, objective_min,
4289  objective_max);
4290 }
4291 
4292 void FindOneNeighbor::SynchronizeAll(Solver* solver) {
4293  pool_->GetNextSolution(reference_assignment_.get());
4294  neighbor_found_ = false;
4295  limit_->Init();
4296  solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->BeginOperatorStart();
4297  ls_operator_->Start(reference_assignment_.get());
4298  if (filter_manager_ != nullptr) {
4299  filter_manager_->Synchronize(reference_assignment_.get(), nullptr);
4300  }
4301  solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->EndOperatorStart();
4302 }

4396 // ----- NestedSolve decision wrapper -----
4397 
4398 // This decision calls a nested Solve on the given DecisionBuilder in its
4399 // left branch; does nothing in the left branch.
4400 // The state of the decision corresponds to the result of the nested Solve:
4401 // DECISION_PENDING - Nested Solve not called yet
4402 // DECISION_FAILED - Nested Solve failed
4403 // DECISION_FOUND - Nested Solve succeeded
4404 
4405 class NestedSolveDecision : public Decision {
4406  public:
4407  // This enum is used internally to tag states in the local search tree.
4408  enum StateType { DECISION_PENDING, DECISION_FAILED, DECISION_FOUND };
4409 
4410  NestedSolveDecision(DecisionBuilder* const db, bool restore,
4411  const std::vector<SearchMonitor*>& monitors);
4412  NestedSolveDecision(DecisionBuilder* const db, bool restore);
4413  ~NestedSolveDecision() override {}
4414  void Apply(Solver* const solver) override;
4415  void Refute(Solver* const solver) override;
4416  std::string DebugString() const override { return "NestedSolveDecision"; }
4417  int state() const { return state_; }
4418 
4419  private:
4420  DecisionBuilder* const db_;
4421  bool restore_;
4422  std::vector<SearchMonitor*> monitors_;
4423  int state_;
4424 };
4425 
4426 NestedSolveDecision::NestedSolveDecision(
4427  DecisionBuilder* const db, bool restore,
4428  const std::vector<SearchMonitor*>& monitors)
4429  : db_(db),
4430  restore_(restore),
4431  monitors_(monitors),
4432  state_(DECISION_PENDING) {
4433  CHECK(nullptr != db);
4434 }
4435 
4436 NestedSolveDecision::NestedSolveDecision(DecisionBuilder* const db,
4437  bool restore)
4438  : db_(db), restore_(restore), state_(DECISION_PENDING) {
4439  CHECK(nullptr != db);
4440 }
4441 
4442 void NestedSolveDecision::Apply(Solver* const solver) {
4443  CHECK(nullptr != solver);
4444  if (restore_) {
4445  if (solver->Solve(db_, monitors_)) {
4446  solver->SaveAndSetValue(&state_, static_cast<int>(DECISION_FOUND));
4447  } else {
4448  solver->SaveAndSetValue(&state_, static_cast<int>(DECISION_FAILED));
4449  }
4450  } else {
4451  if (solver->SolveAndCommit(db_, monitors_)) {
4452  solver->SaveAndSetValue(&state_, static_cast<int>(DECISION_FOUND));
4453  } else {
4454  solver->SaveAndSetValue(&state_, static_cast<int>(DECISION_FAILED));
4455  }
4456  }
4457 }
4458 
4459 void NestedSolveDecision::Refute(Solver* const solver) {}

4461 // ----- Local search decision builder -----
4462 
4463 // Given a first solution (resulting from either an initial assignment or the
4464 // result of a decision builder), it searches for neighbors using a local
4465 // search operator. The first solution corresponds to the first leaf of the
4466 // search.
4467 // The local search applies to the variables contained either in the assignment
4468 // or the vector of variables passed.

4478  // variables in operators

4480  SolutionPool* const pool, DecisionBuilder* const first_solution,
4481  LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator,
4482  DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder,

4484  LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager);

4486  SolutionPool* const pool, DecisionBuilder* const first_solution,
4487  DecisionBuilder* const first_solution_sub_decision_builder,
4488  LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator,
4489  DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder,
4490  RegularLimit* const limit,
4491  LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager);
4492  LocalSearch(const std::vector<SequenceVar*>& vars, IntVar* objective,
4493  SolutionPool* const pool, DecisionBuilder* const first_solution,
4494  LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator,
4495  DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder,
4496  RegularLimit* const limit,
4497  LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager);
4498  ~LocalSearch() override;
4499  Decision* Next(Solver* const solver) override;
4500  std::string DebugString() const override { return "LocalSearch"; }
4501  void Accept(ModelVisitor* const visitor) const override;
4502 
4503  protected:
4504  void PushFirstSolutionDecision(DecisionBuilder* first_solution);

4511  LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator_;
4512  DecisionBuilder* const first_solution_sub_decision_builder_;
4513  DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder_;
4514  std::vector<NestedSolveDecision*> nested_decisions_;
4515  int nested_decision_index_;
4516  RegularLimit* const limit_;

4630 // Model Visitor support.
4631 void LocalSearch::Accept(ModelVisitor* const visitor) const {
4632  DCHECK(assignment_ != nullptr);
4633  visitor->BeginVisitExtension(ModelVisitor::kVariableGroupExtension);
4634  // We collect decision variables from the assignment.
4635  const std::vector<IntVarElement>& elements =
4636  assignment_->IntVarContainer().elements();
4637  if (!elements.empty()) {
4638  std::vector<IntVar*> vars;
4639  for (const IntVarElement& elem : elements) {
4640  vars.push_back(elem.Var());
4641  }
4642  visitor->VisitIntegerVariableArrayArgument(ModelVisitor::kVarsArgument,
4643  vars);
4644  }
4645  const std::vector<IntervalVarElement>& interval_elements =
4646  assignment_->IntervalVarContainer().elements();
4647  if (!interval_elements.empty()) {
4648  std::vector<IntervalVar*> interval_vars;
4649  for (const IntervalVarElement& elem : interval_elements) {
4650  interval_vars.push_back(elem.Var());
4651  }
4652  visitor->VisitIntervalArrayArgument(ModelVisitor::kIntervalsArgument,
4653  interval_vars);
4654  }
4655  visitor->EndVisitExtension(ModelVisitor::kVariableGroupExtension);
4656 }
4657 
4658 // This is equivalent to a multi-restart decision builder
4659 // TODO(user): abstract this from the local search part
4660 // TODO(user): handle the case where the tree depth is not enough to hold
4661 // all solutions.
4662 
4663 Decision* LocalSearch::Next(Solver* const solver) {
4664  CHECK(nullptr != solver);
4665  CHECK_LT(0, nested_decisions_.size());
4666  if (!has_started_) {
4667  nested_decision_index_ = 0;
4668  solver->SaveAndSetValue(&has_started_, true);
4669  } else if (nested_decision_index_ < 0) {
4670  solver->Fail();
4671  }
4672  NestedSolveDecision* decision = nested_decisions_[nested_decision_index_];
4673  const int state = decision->state();
4674  switch (state) {
4675  case NestedSolveDecision::DECISION_FAILED: {
4676  // A local optimum has been reached. The search will continue only if we
4677  // accept up-hill moves (due to metaheuristics). In this case we need to
4678  // reset neighborhood optimal routes.
4679  ls_operator_->Reset();
4680  if (!LocalOptimumReached(solver->ActiveSearch())) {
4681  nested_decision_index_ = -1; // Stop the search
4682  }
4683  solver->Fail();
4684  return nullptr;
4685  }
4686  case NestedSolveDecision::DECISION_PENDING: {
4687  // TODO(user): Find a way to make this balancing invisible to the
4688  // user (no increase in branch or fail counts for instance).
4689  const int32_t kLocalSearchBalancedTreeDepth = 32;
4690  const int depth = solver->SearchDepth();
4691  if (depth < kLocalSearchBalancedTreeDepth) {
4692  return solver->balancing_decision();
4693  }
4694  if (depth > kLocalSearchBalancedTreeDepth) {
4695  solver->Fail();
4696  }
4697  return decision;
4698  }
4699  case NestedSolveDecision::DECISION_FOUND: {
4700  // Next time go to next decision
4701  if (nested_decision_index_ + 1 < nested_decisions_.size()) {
4702  ++nested_decision_index_;
4703  }
4704  return nullptr;
4705  }
4706  default: {
4707  LOG(ERROR) << "Unknown local search state";
4708  return nullptr;
4709  }
4710  }
4711  return nullptr;
4712 }
4713 
4714 void LocalSearch::PushFirstSolutionDecision(DecisionBuilder* first_solution) {
4715  CHECK(first_solution);
4716  Solver* const solver = assignment_->solver();
4717  DecisionBuilder* store = solver->MakeStoreAssignment(assignment_);
4718  DecisionBuilder* first_solution_and_store = solver->Compose(
4719  first_solution, first_solution_sub_decision_builder_, store);
4720  std::vector<SearchMonitor*> monitor;
4721  monitor.push_back(limit_);
4722  nested_decisions_.push_back(solver->RevAlloc(
4723  new NestedSolveDecision(first_solution_and_store, false, monitor)));
4724 }
4725 
4726 void LocalSearch::PushLocalSearchDecision() {
4727  Solver* const solver = assignment_->solver();
4728  DecisionBuilder* find_neighbors = solver->RevAlloc(
4729  new FindOneNeighbor(assignment_, objective_, pool_, ls_operator_,
4730  sub_decision_builder_, limit_, filter_manager_));
4731  nested_decisions_.push_back(
4732  solver->RevAlloc(new NestedSolveDecision(find_neighbors, false)));
4733 }
4734 
4735 class DefaultSolutionPool : public SolutionPool {
4736  public:
4737  DefaultSolutionPool() {}
4738 
4739  ~DefaultSolutionPool() override {}
4740 
4741  void Initialize(Assignment* const assignment) override {
4742  reference_assignment_ = absl::make_unique<Assignment>(assignment);
4743  }
4744 
4745  void RegisterNewSolution(Assignment* const assignment) override {
4746  reference_assignment_->CopyIntersection(assignment);
4747  }
4748 
4749  void GetNextSolution(Assignment* const assignment) override {
4750  assignment->CopyIntersection(reference_assignment_.get());
4751  }
4752 
4753  bool SyncNeeded(Assignment* const local_assignment) override { return false; }
4754 
4755  std::string DebugString() const override { return "DefaultSolutionPool"; }
4756 
4757  private:
4758  std::unique_ptr<Assignment> reference_assignment_;
4759 };
4760 } // namespace
